bill_title: provide for the issuance of landowner-sponsored big game hunting licenses.
keywords: Department of Game, Fish and Parks

bill_versions.bill_text: FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to provide for the issuance of transferable landowner big game hunting licenses. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. That chapter 41-6 be amended by adding thereto a NEW SECTION to read as follows: The Game, Fish and Parks Commission shall promulgate rules pursuant to chapter 1-26 to establish a program for the issuance of transferable big game hunting licenses to the owners or lessees of land located in South Dakota. Under the program any landowner or lessee who owns or leases at least six hundred forty acres of agricultural, grazing, or timber land in the program area may apply for and receive one transferable big game hunting license in addition to any big game license to which the landowner or lessee would otherwise be entitled. Each transferable license shall be issued at the same cost as a corresponding nontransferable license. The landowner or lessee may sell or transfer the license to a hunter for use on the landowner's or lessee's property. Section 2. That § 41-6-71 be amended to read as follows: 41-6-71. No Except as provided in section 1 of this Act, no license issued under this chapter or part of a license or tag is transferable. A violation of this section is a Class 1 misdemeanor. Section 3. Sections 1 and 2 of this Act are repealed on July 1, 2010.

bill_versions.bill_version: House Agriculture and Natural Resources Engrossed
bill_versions.bill_text: FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to provide for the issuance of landowner-sponsored big game hunting licenses. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. That chapter 41-6 be amended by adding thereto a NEW SECTION to read as follows: The Game, Fish and Parks Commission shall promulgate rules pursuant to chapter 1-26 to establish a program for the issuance of landowner-sponsored big game hunting licenses to persons designated by the owners or lessees of land located in South Dakota. Under the program any resident landowner or lessee who owns or leases at least six hundred forty acres of agricultural, grazing, or timber land in South Dakota may sponsor a resident or nonresident applicant for one landowner-sponsored big game hunting license in addition to any big game license to which the landowner or lessee would otherwise be entitled. Each landowner- sponsored applicant shall be issued a landowner-sponsored license at the same cost as a corresponding landowner license. The landowner-sponsored license may only be used on the landowner's or lessee's property. Section 2. Section 1 of this Act is repealed on July 1, 2010.
